intro: Peucedanum dehradunense, commonly known as the Dehradun cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, white or yellowish flowers appear in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Peucedanum dehradunense is often found in forested areas and along stream banks in its natural habitat.
